segments.en: “Mendicants, suppose there was a sharp-pointed spear.
And a man came along and thought,

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ imaṃ sattiṃ tiṇhaphalaṃ pāṇinā vā muṭṭhinā vā paṭileṇissāmi paṭikoṭṭissāmi paṭivaṭṭessāmī’ti.
segments.en: ‘With my hand or fist I’ll fold this sharp spear over, bend it back, and twist it around!’

segments.pli: bhabbo nu kho so puriso amuṃ sattiṃ tiṇhaphalaṃ pāṇinā vā muṭṭhinā vā paṭileṇetuṃ paṭikoṭṭetuṃ paṭivaṭṭetun”ti?
segments.en: Is that man capable of doing so?”

segments.pli: “Asu hi, bhante, satti tiṇhaphalā na sukarā pāṇinā vā muṭṭhinā vā paṭileṇetuṃ paṭikoṭṭetuṃ paṭivaṭṭetuṃ.
segments.en: Because it’s not easy to fold that sharp spear over, bend it back, and twist it around with the hand or fist.

segments.pli: Yāvadeva ca pana so puriso kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assā”ti.
segments.en: That man will eventually get weary and frustrated.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno mettācetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, tassa ce amanusso cittaṃ khipitabbaṃ maññeyya;
segments.en: “In the same way, suppose a mendicant has developed the heart’s release by love, has cultivated it, made it a vehicle and a basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it. Should any non-human think to overthrow their mind,

segments.pli: atha kho sveva amanusso kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assa.
segments.en: they’ll eventually get weary and frustrated.
So you should train like this:

segments.pli: ‘mettā no cetovimutti bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā’ti.
segments.en: ‘We will develop the heart’s release by love. We’ll cultivate it, make it our vehicle and our basis, keep it up, consolidate it, and properly implement it.’

suttaplex.blurb: As it is not possible to bend back a spear, it is not possible to overthrow a mendicant who has developed love.
